column4: Do I have much chance of customising a LiveCD inside a LiveCD with 2gb RAM?
dual-booting?
'Cause I've partitioned my HDD to death and I want to run an OS from RAM
that would require loading the OS into ram every time you boot
which...would be slow
it would also mean that you can't install any new programs...you can, but it will all be lost if you need to reboot
that's what SSD's are for
you can create a ramdisk if you really want to
this is what SSDs are made for...you can get one large enough to hold your OS for not too much $$$
SSDs?
you snooze you lose?
Solid State Drives.
they're basically flash memory that acts as a hard drive...the Next Big Thing
it's not quite as fast as RAM, but you don't loose all the data when your computer shuts down, or hibernates
it's flash-based, so it's much faster
they last longer than conventional HDDs
SSD != RAM drive
/tmp is usually in RAM
are you speaking of D-mn Small Linux?
DSL isn't really for a desktop...it's very, very minimal
it's used mostly as a rescue distro, with certain uses in small devices that don't need many programs
DSL isn't for desktop use
if you create it, it's automatically GPL'd
okay, i'm not that familiarwith theasoftware licenses, but i'll take your word for it
